title: When your average Normal games actually get better player/teammate quality than Ranked
body:
Feels weird man, why is it that?

It's not that often to see people in Normals ignoring important objectives altogether, have 0 map awareness, can't teamfight and prioritise targets at all, or trash talk in /all throughout on the entire game. But they've all happened in Ranked, as in, they are usually all within the same game.

It's not like I'm better, I mean, I'm in Silver5 for a reason. But I at least get arguably better teammates to work with in Normals (since everything counts when you're bad).... which is just odd, because that shouldn't have been the case really.

Oh well.

>
> Are you new?

New to Ranked I suppose. I never quite played Ranked despite playing League for like 4 years or something.

you need to get just a little higher to around silver 3-4, the difference in skill isn't really noticeable, but the people you meet are much better and you'll see alot more teamwork, rotations, map awareness, tp ganks, ect. People aren't necessarily better, but they're alot more contentious of their team and not just tunnel visioned on their own champion.

Yes this elo isn't amazing or impressive, but I consider it a refuge where people who like this game and are nice, but not necessarily good at the game, can just stay and have fun. You also see alot less people here complaining about stuff or not getting jungle help, ect... You'll see encouragement, recognition of a good play from friend and foe alike and friendly banter in chat and you'll have a pretty good time chatting with both your own and the enemy team, whenever a number of you are stuck in deathtimers after a particularly chaotic teamfight.

Silver 5 tends to be a bit uptight since everyone there is afraid because they are on the cusp of bronze, but once you gain a bit of breathing room, most people in silver tend to be pretty nice, at least until you start getting near gold, in which case people start getting really stressed about the game and just can't chill and be pleasant.

... rip I really need to do well in my placements this season to get back there, because I don't think I'll survive getting chewed out by the bronze elo. I'll probably just tilt every game or fail to be impactful enough and end up being stuck there for eternity.
